arts.ttl: PLAYER RATINGS | Borussia Dortmund 1-0 Wolfsburg – Adeyemi wondergoal secures BVB win
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund returned to Bundesliga action at the Westfalenstadion to close Matchday 4, facing Wolfsburg just days after their pulsating Champions League clash with Juventus in Turin. Die Wölfe, meanwhile,…

arts.ttl: Karim Adeyemi's rocket gives Borussia Dortmund narrow win over Wolfsburg
arts.sum: Karim Adeyemi's stunning long-range strike secured a 1-0 win for Borussia Dortmund against Wolfsburg, with Niko Kovač's side maintaining their unbeaten start to the season and moving into second in the table. Borussia Dortmund came into this match looking to build on their strong start to the season, having collected seven points from their first three Bundesliga matches.

arts.ttl: Adeyemi’s stunner help Dortmund beat Wolfsburg
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund extend their winning streak to three league games with a 1-0 success over Wolfsburg.

arts.ttl: Confirmed Lineups: Borussia Dortmund vs. VfL Wolfsburg
arts.sum: Here are the two starting lineups for the last game of matchday 4.

arts.ttl: Borussia Dortmund vs Wolfsburg – Match preview and team news
arts.sum: Borussia Dortmund and VfL Wolfsburg clash in the Bundesliga on Sunday evening. Both sides will be looking to maintain their unbeaten starts to the season, with Dortmund currently third in the table and Wolfsburg sitting 10th. arts.ttl: Borussia Dortmund vs. VfL Wolfsburg preview: Die Wolfe keen to snap winless streak in Dortmund
arts.sum: The hosts will be hoping to maintain their dominance on home turf over their Lower-Saxony opponents on Sunday evening in the Ruhrpott.

arts.ttl: Christian Eriksen on joining Wolfsburg, his friendship with Harry Kane, and facing Borussia Dortmund
arts.sum: In an exclusive interview, new Wolfsburg signing Christian Eriksen says his move to the club "felt fun to try", while he also reflected on his friendship with Bayern Munich's Harry Kane and looks forward to potentially making his Bundesliga debut at Borussia Dortmund on Sunday. Eriksen: “I think that's something we will see on the pitch because obviously I'm here as a footballer to try to help the team on the pitch.
